intro: Urera keayi, commonly known as the Keay’s urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
